excerpt: This temple and site of pilgrimage is one of the holiest in the Hindu religion with several shrines.
detail_description: Sri Arulmigu Ramanathaswamy Temple is a significant pilgrimage site in Hinduism, attracting thousands of devotees year-round. According to the Hindu epic Ramayana, it is believed that Lord Rama prayed to Lord Shiva at this temple after his victory in Lanka. The temple's grand structure features long corridors and intricately carved pillars, including a towering 38-meter Gopuram.
name: Sri Arulmigu Ramanathaswamy Temple
address: E Car St, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Lakshmana Tirtham is a stunning waterfall nestled in the picturesque hills of the Eastern Ghats in Tamil Nadu, India. This natural marvel not only captivates visitors with its beauty but also holds great religious significance as it is named after Lakshmana, the revered brother of Lord Rama in Hindu mythology.
name: Lakshmana Tirtham
address: 78P4+7FV, AH43, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: Brightly painted temple to a 5-faced deity, with carved "floating stones" linked to a mythic bridge.
detail_description: Sri Panchmukhi Hanuman Mandir, located near the renowned Ramanathaswamy Temple, is a vibrant shrine dedicated to the five-faced deity, Hanuman. The temple features a large black stone statue of Lord Hanuman with five faces, each representing different Hindu deities. According to legend, this form of Hanuman emerged when he extinguished five lamps simultaneously to defeat Mahiravana and save Lord Rama and Lord Lakshman.
name: Sri Panchmukhi Hanuman temple and Floating Stones
address: Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: Small museum in the childhood home of India’s one-time president, with photos & memorabilia.
detail_description: House of Kalam, also known as APJ Abdul Kalam House or Museum, is a small museum located in the childhood home of India's former president. Situated in Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu, this conch-shaped island is a popular tourist destination known for its pilgrimage sites, natural beauty, and Hindu temples. The museum showcases photos and memorabilia related to Dr.
name: House of Kalam (APJ Abdul Kalam House / Museum
address: 12/7, Mosque Street, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: Rameswaram is a town on Pamban Island, in the southeast Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It’s known for Ramanathaswamy Temple, a Hindu pilgrimage site with ornate corridors, huge sculpted pillars and sacred water tanks. Devotees bathe in the waters of Agni Theertham, off the beach east of the temple. Gandamadana Parvatham is a hill with island views. A chakra (wheel) here is said to bear an imprint of Lord Rama’s feet.
detail_description: Rameswaram, located on Pamban Island in Tamil Nadu, is a significant pilgrimage site known for the Ramanathaswamy Temple. This Hindu temple features intricate corridors, grand sculpted pillars, and sacred water tanks where devotees bathe. The town's proximity to the Gulf of Mannar and its mention in the Hindu epic Ramayana add to its historical and mythological significance. Rameswaram also boasts pristine beaches that offer tranquility and adventure along its coastline.
name: Rameswaram
address: Tamil Nadu, India

detail_description: Gandhamadana Parvatham, the highest point in Rameswaram, offers panoramic views of the island and the sea. It is believed to bear Lord Ram's foot imprint on a chakra and is where Lord Hanuman placed sacred herbs for Lord Ram's wounds. This high-altitude spot is also associated with significant events from the epic Ramayana, such as Hanuman's departure to Lanka and Vibheeshana being crowned by Lord Rama before the journey to Lanka.
name: Gandhamadhana Parvatham
address: Parvatham, Gandhamadana, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: Well-known pilgrimage site where childless couples come to bathe & pray to Lord Shiva.
detail_description: Agni Teertham is a significant pilgrimage site located just 100 meters away from the Rameshwaram temple in Tamil Nadu, India. It holds great religious importance as it is believed that Lord Rama worshipped Lord Shiva here to cleanse himself of the sin of killing Demon king Ravana. The site attracts childless couples who come to bathe and pray for blessings from Lord Shiva.
name: Agni Teertham

detail_description: Sākshī Hanumān Temple, also known as the Five-Faced Hanuman Temple or Panchamukhi Hanuman Temple, is a revered Hindu temple located near Sri Ramanathaswamy Temple. It is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and is famous for its unique representation of the deity with five faces, each symbolizing different aspects of his character.
name: Sākshī Hanumān Temple
address: GP Rd, Kendhamana paruvatham, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Agnitheertham Bus Stop is a convenient starting point for exploring the attractions of Rameshwaram, including the renowned Ramanathaswamy Temple, Jada Theertham, Dhanushkodi, Panchamukhi Hanuman Temple, Kalam National Memorial and Gandamadana Parvatham. With about 64 sacred theerthas in the area, visitors can partake in a spiritual experience by bathing in these holy waters.
name: Agnitheertham Bus Stop
address: V. O. C. Nagar, Sudukattanpatti, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Sri Ramar Temple, located just 8 km from the Ramanathaswamy shrine, is a stunning shrine with a rich mythological history. It's said that Lord Rama appointed Vibishana as the monarch of Lanka near this temple. Despite being hit by the cyclone of 1964, it's the only construction that stood its ground. The temple boasts an impressive infrastructure and ancient pillars surrounding it.
name: Sri Ramar Temple
address: Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: Tranquil public beach, popular for strolling & watching the activities of nearby fishing boats.
detail_description: Sangumal Beach in Rameswaram is a serene and popular public beach known for its tranquil atmosphere, soft golden sands, and turquoise blue waters. It offers breathtaking landscapes and is perfect for strolling while watching the activities of nearby fishing boats. The beach also serves as a source of livelihood for local fishermen who can be seen engaging in their daily fishing activities.
name: Sangumal Beach, Rameswaram
address: Olaikaddu Rd, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Located in Rameshwaram, the Holy Island Water Sports is the only water sports center in the area. It offers a range of activities such as banana rides, speed boating, kayaking, glass boat rides, family boat rides, snorkeling and more. The center operates on a private beach with well-trained instructors and well-maintained equipment. Visitors can enjoy various water sports activities under the watchful eye of attentive lifeguards.
name: Holy Island Water Sports
address: Sangumall, Olaikudda Road, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam House, located in Rameshwaram, holds significance as the former residence of India's beloved President. The locals take pride in this connection, celebrating his appointment and cherishing the honor it brought to their community.
name: Dr.APJ Abdul kalam House
address: Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Ahaan Restaurant at Daiwik Hotels Rameshwaram is a popular dining spot that can accommodate around 60-70 people at a time. The restaurant offers an amazing buffet with a wide variety of vegetarian food, including continental, South Indian, and North Indian dishes along with delectable desserts. The ambiance is impressive with modern lighting and architecture, creating a spacious area with a mini lounge and dessert section.
name: Ahaan Restaurant - Daiwik Hotels Rameshwaram
address: Bus stand, 82 B (1), Madurai-Dhanushkodi NH- 49, near Rameswaram, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

name: Dr.A.P.J Abdul kalam house
address: 78Q7+25P, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Rameshwaram Temple, nestled in the heart of southern India, is a magnificent shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva and holds the esteemed status of one of the 12 jyotirlingas. This temple is steeped in rich Hindu mythology, with legends suggesting that Lord Rama and Sita constructed two lingams that are now enshrined within its sacred walls. The temple attracts a multitude of devotees from across India, creating a vibrant atmosphere filled with faith and devotion.
name: Rameshwaram Temple
address: 78Q8+PX9, N Car St, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: Sangumal Beach, located in the enchanting town of Rameshwaram in Tamil Nadu, is not just a picturesque destination but also steeped in rich cultural significance. As one of the Char Dham Pilgrim Centers, it holds a special place for devotees and travelers alike. According to the epic Ramayana, this beach was where Lord Rama crossed over to rescue Goddess Sita from the clutches of Demon Ravana.
name: The Sangumal Beach - Rameshwaram Town, Ramanathapuram District, Tamil Nadu, India
address: Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

detail_description: In the enchanting town of Rameswaram, Tamil is the predominant language that resonates through its vibrant streets and cultural landmarks. However, travelers need not worry as English and Hindi are widely understood in many tourist hotspots. This linguistic diversity makes it easier for visitors to connect with locals and immerse themselves in the rich heritage of this sacred destination. Whether you're exploring ancient temples or enjoying local cuisine, communication flows smoothly, allowing you to fully experience all that Rameswaram has to offer.
name: Hindi pandit ji Rameswaram
address: Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: A narrow 9-mile-long sandy island beach between the Indian Ocean & Bay of Bengal with strong surf.
detail_description: Dhanushkodi Beach is a 9-mile-long sandy island beach located between the Indian Ocean and Bay of Bengal, known for its strong surf. It holds great mythological significance as it is believed to be the birthplace of Ram-Setu or Adams Bridge, constructed by Lord Ram to connect India with Sri Lanka.
name: Dhanushkodi Beach
address: Tamil Nadu, India

excerpt: Burial site of former President of India Dr A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, marked by a life-sized statue.
detail_description: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Memorial in Rameswaram is a significant attraction that honors the life and achievements of India's former President, Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, who was not only a respected leader but also a renowned scientist. The memorial features a life-sized statue and four halls showcasing pivotal moments from his life, including his contributions to India's space and defense programs.
name: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Memorial
address: 77QC+793, Dhanushkodi Road, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: 2-story hilltop Hindu temple with holy wells, a shrine to Lord Rama's footprints & good views.
detail_description: Ramar Padam temple, located in Dhanushkodi, Gandha Madhana Parvatham, Kendhamana paruvatham in Rameswaram, is a two-story hilltop Hindu temple with sacred wells and a shrine featuring Lord Rama's footprints. It is considered a must-visit after the Arulmigu Ramanathaswamy temple. According to local belief, this is where Hanuman took his first leap to reach Sri Lanka.
name: Ramar Padam temple
address: Gandha Madhana Parvatham, Kendhamana paruvatham, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: This tranquil beachfront features a wide sandy expanse, clear waters & a revered freshwater spring.
detail_description: Villoondi Theertham is a serene and spiritual beachfront in Rameswaram, known for its wide sandy expanse, clear waters, and a revered freshwater spring. This hidden gem is one of the 64 sacred water bodies in the area and offers a peaceful escape from the usual tourist spots. While accessibility can be a challenge, the breathtaking views and unique history make it worth the visit.
name: Villoondi Theertham
address: Thangachimadam Rd, Rameswaram, Thangachimadam, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

excerpt: Humble Hindu temple on a small island on the Palk Strait, dedicated to Rama & featuring a veranda.
detail_description: Kothanda Ramar Temple is a serene and historical Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Sri Rama, situated just a few kilometers before Dhanushkodi. The temple holds significance as it is believed to be the place where Lord Rama crowned Vibhishana as the King of Lanka after the war. Surrounded by the ocean, this peaceful temple offers a picturesque setting and features statues of Lord Rama, Mata Sita, Lakshman, and King Vibishana.
name: Kothanda Ramar Temple
address: Temple, Kochi - Madurai - Dhanushkodi Rd, Munichallai, Madurai, Tamil Nadu 625009, India

detail_description: The Old Dhanushkodi Railway Station, located in Tamil Nadu, is a haunting reminder of the devastating 1964 cyclone that destroyed the area. Situated between the Bay of Bengal and the Indian Ocean, this abandoned station offers a glimpse into history amidst its ruined structure. Peacocks roam the vicinity while small shops sell shells, artifacts, and even seafood. The remnants of this once-thriving city include an old water tank and parts of a church.
name: Old Dhanushkodi Railway Station
address: 5CH8+P6X, Dhanushkodi, Tamil Nadu 623526, India

name: Dodo Island Exotic Birds Park
address: Dodo Island, opp. SSM Mahal, Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu 623526, India
